snippet: After a week of tense negotiations, Greece and its foreign lenders agreed on a new round of austerity measures that must be taken by the country to unlock the crucial rescue funds.
abstract: Euro zone finance ministers meeting in Brussels decide to continue drip-feeding payments of emergency aid to Greece, forcing country to agree to new round of austerity measures in order to access crucial rescue funds; at same time, as many as 5,000 Greeks join demonstrations in Athens against government's austerity plans.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN, NIKI KITSANTONIS and JAMES KANTER
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman and Niki Kitsantonis reported from Athens, and James Kanter from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: After a week of tense negotiations, Greece and its foreign lenders agreed on a new round of austerity measures that must be taken by the country to unlock the crucial rescue funds.

headline.main: With Aid, Europe Keeps Pressure on Greece to Restructure Economy
headline.print_headline: With Aid, Europe Keeps Pressure on Greece to Restructure Economy
